verses.text: \w The|strong="H3068"\w* inscription \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w a|strong="H3068"\w* title \w to|strong="H3068"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* himself. Preserve me, \w O|strong="H3068"\w* \w Lord|strong="H3068"\w*, \w for|strong="H3068"\w* \w I|strong="H3068"\w* \w have|strong="H3068"\w* put trust \w in|strong="H3068"\w* thee.

I \w have|strong="H1696"\w* \w said|strong="H1696"\w* \w to|strong="H1696"\w* \w the|strong="H1696"\w* Lord, thou art \w my|strong="H1696"\w* God, \w for|strong="H6664"\w* thou hast no need \w of|strong="H6466"\w* \w my|strong="H1696"\w* goods.

\w To|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* saints, \w who|strong="H7138"\w* \w are|strong="H7138"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w his|strong="H5921"\w* land, \w he|strong="H6213"\w* hath \w made|strong="H6213"\w* wonderful all \w my|strong="H5921"\w* desires \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w them|strong="H5921"\w*.

\w Their|strong="H3068"\w* infirmities \w were|strong="H5869"\w* multiplied: afterwards \w they|strong="H3808"\w* \w made|strong="H3513"\w* haste. \w I|strong="H3808"\w* \w will|strong="H3068"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* gather together \w their|strong="H3068"\w* meetings \w for|strong="H3068"\w* blood \w offerings|strong="H3068"\w*: \w nor|strong="H3808"\w* \w will|strong="H3068"\w* \w I|strong="H3808"\w* \w be|strong="H3808"\w* mindful \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w their|strong="H3068"\w* names \w by|strong="H3068"\w* \w my|strong="H3068"\w* lips.

\w The|strong="H5921"\w* Lord \w is|strong="H3701"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* portion \w of|strong="H5921"\w* \w my|strong="H5414"\w* inheritance \w and|strong="H3701"\w* \w of|strong="H5921"\w* \w my|strong="H5414"\w* cup: \w it|strong="H5414"\w* \w is|strong="H3701"\w* thou \w that|strong="H3808"\w* wilt restore \w my|strong="H5414"\w* inheritance \w to|strong="H5921"\w* \w me|strong="H5414"\w*.
The lines are fallen unto me in goodly places: for my inheritance is goodly to me.
I will bless the Lord, who hath given me understanding: moreover my reins also have corrected me even till night.
I set the Lord always in my sight: for he is at my right hand, that I be not moved.
Therefore my heart hath been glad, and my tongue hath rejoiced: moreover my flesh also shall rest in hope.
Because thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; nor wilt then give thy holy one to see corruption.
Thou hast made known to me the ways of life, thou shalt fill me with joy with thy countenance: at thy right hand are delights even to the end.
